name: Media Source Tracing
description: Traces media reports back to primary sources and assesses outlet credibility. Based on First Draft's Five Pillars of Verification and the SIFT method. Media reports are secondary sources that must be traced to primaries.

task.purpose: Trace the media report "{evidence.description}" back to its primary source. Media reports are secondary sources — the investigation must establish what underlying evidence the report is based on.
keyTasks: Identify what primary source(s) the media report is based on (study, document, interview, event).
Check if the media report accurately represents the primary source.
task.endState: Primary source identified and located (or confirmed unlocatable), accuracy of media representation assessed, editorialization documented.

requiredOutputs.description: The primary source the media report is based on
Whether the primary source was located
Whether the media report accurately represents the primary source

task.purpose: Assess the credibility of the media outlet and journalist behind "{evidence.description}". The messenger affects the reliability of the message — ownership, editorial stance, and track record matter.
keyTasks: Research the media outlet: ownership, editorial stance, known biases, track record of corrections/retractions.
Research the journalist: beat, track record, awards, corrections.
Check Media Bias/Fact Check or equivalent ratings.
Note any known affiliations or conflicts of interest.
task.endState: Outlet and journalist profiled: ownership traced, bias assessed, track record documented, fact-check ratings noted.

requiredOutputs.description: Track record of corrections and retractions
Media Bias/Fact Check or equivalent rating

task.purpose: Cross-reference "{evidence.description}" against independent reporting. Where outlets converge is likely accurate; where they diverge is likely editorialized or uncertain.
keyTasks: Search for independent reporting on the same topic from other outlets.
Compare how different outlets present the same information.
Note where outlets converge (likely accurate) and diverge (likely editorialized or uncertain).
Assess whether the independent reports trace back to the same primary source or different ones.
task.endState: Independent reporting landscape mapped: convergence points identified, divergence points documented, source independence assessed.

requiredOutputs.description: Independent reports found on the same topic
